records.Name: Standard and Custom Objects
records.Description__c: We've got an upcoming mission in New York.
records.Requirements__c: Select their latest mission for New York: "E.V.I.L HQ Raid" from the Missions related List
records.Value__c:
Tables in Salesforce are called Objects. The platform comes with standard objects like Accounts and Contacts so you can build apps around your customers


Without any code, you can also create custom objects (like Mission) to track data and processes that are unique to your organization.

records.Name: Open the Mission Planning App
records.Description__c: The SuperRangers have access to multiple apps on Salesforce and use a custom app to manage their missions, assignments, and equipment. Let's take a look.
records.Requirements__c:
Click the App Launcher

Notice the apps in the launcher

Open the Mission Planning App
records.Value__c: Every company can build custom apps around their customers for any role and department, not just sales and service.

records.Name: Ask a Benefits Question
records.Description__c:
As you can see, we've customized Salesforce for our "business" of fighting evil. BUT we also use Salesforce for things that every company deals with, like getting questions answered.

You've been thinking about picking up a superpower, but aren't sure how that will affect your ability to do your current tech job.
records.Requirements__c:
Click the "Waffle Menu" to switch to our Employee Community.

  1. At the top of our community, search for our mutation leave policy
  2. Ask a question about the policy.
records.Trailhead_Content__c:
Employee Community Basics

Community Search

Salesforce Knowledge
records.Value__c:
Salesforce Communities are a way to provide a branded experience to engage customers, partners, and employees.


Employee Communities are great for help desk, knowledge base, and collaboration. Employees can get answers and help faster, and departments like HR and IT can deliver better service with less work.

records.Name: Equip your Mission
records.Description__c: We need to make sure our heroes have what they need.
records.Requirements__c:
On the New York mission from the previous step, add some equipment:

  1. Add 2 sets of binoculars
  2. Add 5 granola bars (We don't want CodeBear getting hangry like last year in Buenos Aires)
  3. Add 3 grappling hooks
records.Trailhead_Content__c:
External Data Sources

Custom Lightning Components
records.Value__c:
Salesforce makes it easy to create custom UI. Here, there's a Lightning Component on the page to make it easy to see our inventory and restock as needed.


What may surprise you is that this data is kept outside of Salesforce--we're actually making a real-time callout to another system to see our inventory.

records.Name: Global Search
records.Description__c: The city of New York needs our help.
records.Requirements__c: Find the Account for New York City using Global Search (the big box at the top that says "Search Salesforce")
records.Value__c: Everything in Salesforce is searchable, including records, files, and discussions.

records.Name: Customize Your App With Lightning App Builder and Components
records.Description__c: The Lightning Platform allows our heroes to build apps without any code. Let's go behind the scenes into the setup and administatin screen to see how Trailblazers can build and customize apps with Lightning Components.
records.Requirements__c:
1. Click here to open App Builder in a new window (normally you'd click the gear icon in the top right and "Edit Page", but sometimes it's handy to have your instructions in a separate window!).
  2. In the left panel are lightning components (reusable blocks of code) Salesforce offers for you to customize the app.
  3. Find the Path component and drag it into the header (just below the helicopter icon)
  4. Click the Save button in the top right
  5. Return to this page and refresh your browser to see the path component you've added go live
records.Trailhead_Content__c:
Path Configuration

Custom Record Pages in App Builder
records.Value__c: AppBuilder lets you add standard components, components from the Salesforce AppExchange, or custom components built by your developers.

records.Name: Automate Mission Status With Process Builder
records.Description__c: Sometimes we forget to update statuses on our missions. Let's say that if you're adding heroes and equipment to a mission, but it's still in "Requested" status, that the system just automatically moves it to "Planning" status
records.Requirements__c:
1. open Process Builder (through setup or via link)
  2. select the process called Mission Automation (Trial Task)
  3. under Immediate Actions click + Add Action
  4. set the type to Update Records
  5. give the action a name like Automatic status update
  6. Record Type should be Select the Mission__c record that started your process
  7. Select status from the field dropdown, then select Planning from the value dropdown
  8. Save the action
  9. Activate the process with the button in the top right
records.Trailhead_Content__c:
• Process Builder Quick Start
  • Process Automation
records.Value__c: Process Builder automates field updates, notifications via email or chatter, creates records, and can even start other processes, flows, approvals, or execute custom code.

records.Name: Volunteer
records.Description__c: Besides saving the world with our superpowers, it's important to be out helping people. We use our community to organize our volunteer events.
records.Requirements__c:
Click to the volunteering tab to see events

  1. Sign up for one of our upcoming volunteer events
  2. On the event's feed, invite CodeBear to join (just use @CodeBear and he'll get notified)
records.Value__c:
Communities can do more than just knowledge and helpdesk...any data or process that you can build in Salesforce, like volunteer signup, can be added to the community.


Then you can share parts of your community with employees AND people outside your company.

records.Name: Congratulations! You've Completed the Mission!
records.Description__c:
You're all finished with our Lightning Platform free trial.


There's tons more app building tools for you to explore in the Setup menu in the upper right.


You can explore on your own or head over to Trailhead where hundreds of trails can take you on guided learning journeys through Salesforce.


If you have any questions or feedback, please use the feedback button to share.

records.Name: Plan a Mission
records.Requirements__c:
Assign any 2 heroes to the mission. Since you're new, I'd recommend Cloudy and CodeBear.

Click Save after selecting each hero
records.Value__c: Custom Actions, like the one created for "Assign Heroes" can help make it easy for your end users to do their work.
